content:
Diagnosis:		Follicular thyroid carcinoma

Management:		Total thyroidectomy March 2023
		Radioactive iodine ablation May 2023

Histology:		pT1b (2.3cm) N0 M0, RAS mutation positive

Current situation:	Routine follow-up

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. She remains well following completion of treatment last year. Her thyroid function is well controlled on Levothyroxine 125mcg daily. Recent thyroglobulin level is <0.1 (suppressed) and thyroglobulin antibodies are negative. Neck examination shows well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no concerning features. No palpable cervical lymphadenopathy. Latest ultrasound neck on 15/3/24 shows no evidence of recurrence. She will continue on current Levothyroxine dose with biochemistry monitoring through endocrinology team. Plan for next follow-up in 6 months with repeat thyroglobulin level and neck ultrasound.

cancer_timeline.value: Ultrasound neck shows no evidence of recurrence

patient_facts.value: Well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no concerning features, no palpable cervical lymphadenopathy
Thyroid function well controlled on Levothyroxine 125mcg daily

status_updates.value: Treated follicular thyroid carcinoma with no evidence of recurrence. Stable on thyroid replacement therapy with good biochemical control.
Follow-up in 6 months with repeat thyroglobulin level and neck ultrasound
